title: Bug 4971: Strange 'copy package'
description: When performing the 'copy package' operation in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui in jdt.ui3, the resulting behavior is unexpected. As a result, the destination package 'xxx' contains a package 'ui'.
OB: After performing the 'copy package' operation, the destination package 'xxx' contains a sub-package 'ui'.
EB: The 'copy package' operation should create a copy of the selected package and all its contents in the specified destination without creating any additional sub-packages.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the Eclipse IDE.
2. Navigate to the 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' package in the 'jdt.ui3' project.
3. Right-click on the 'ui' package.
4. Select the 'Copy' option from the context menu.
5. Right-click on the 'xxx' package.
6. Select the 'Paste' option from the context menu.
7. Verify that the 'xxx' package now contains a sub-package named 'ui'.
